summaries.body: A prosecutor featured in "Making a Murderer" said the Netflix documentary omitted crucial facts in the trial of Steven Avery, above, who has drawn a wave of support.

display_asset.caption: Tom Kearney, the York County district attorney, said that along with 247 pounds of marijuana and $11,000 in cash, the authorities found Christopher M. Heath’s badge and duty firearm.

summaries.body: After a Northern California anti-drug task force member was arrested with 200 pounds of marijuana in Pennsylvania, the authorities are reviewing his cases.

display_asset.caption: Birth control pills in the home of a woman who lives in Bend, Ore.

summaries.body: Oregon has enacted a law that enables women to get contraceptives without seeing a doctor, and other states are poised to follow suit. Here's a Q. and A. on the issue.

display_asset.caption: Legendary's hits include “Pacific Rim,” which collected $112 million in China in 2013.
display_asset.credit: Kerry Hayes/Warner Bros. Pictures, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The Dalian Wanda Group of China may buy a majority stake in Legendary Entertainment, a Hollywood company that makes blockbuster-style movies like "Pacific Rim."
The frontman of the British electronic group the Prodigy was threatened by the hacking group Anonymous after it was reported that he has taken up hunting.

display_asset.caption: Jason Wingreen, right, with Carroll O’Connor in “Archie Bunker’s Place.” Mr. Wingreen played Harry the bartender in “All in the Family” and this spinoff.

summaries.body: Jason Wingreen, an actor known for playing the bartender Harry on “All in the Family” and for voicing the bounty hunter Boba Fett in “The Empire Strikes Back,” died at 95.

display_asset.credit: Christopher Simpson for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Chick-fil-A in Midtown Manhattan closed temporarily after performing poorly on a health inspection, but the city still has plenty of fried chicken to offer.

display_asset.caption: Mike Pettine was fired as head coach of the Cleveland Browns on Sunday.

summaries.body: The day after the N.F.L. regular season ends is called Black Monday because of all the front-office changes typically made, but fewer coaches were fired this year than usual.

display_asset.caption: December 10, 2015: Laura Michelle Kelly as Sylvia Llewelyn Davies in the musical "Finding Neverland" at the Lunt-Fontanne Theater.

summaries.body: Led by the musical hits "Wicked," "The Lion King," "Aladdin" and "The Book of Mormon," all of which grossed over $2 million, Broadway had a record-breaking week that was its best attended and highest grossing ever.

display_asset.caption: Kosuke Morita of the Riken institute in Japan led the team with the strongest claim to having discovered element 113 on the periodic table.

summaries.body: Scientists in Japan are set to name a new superheavy element, tentatively named ununtrium, which they are credited with having discovered.
For a sixth week, Adele held the No. 1 spot on Billboard's charts with her new album, "25." In the United States, the album has sold over 7 million copies.

display_asset.caption: Pierre-Yves Roussel and Tory Burch at the 2015 CFDA Fashion Awards in June.

summaries.body: The engagement of the designer Tory Burch and Pierre-Yves Roussel, the chairman of the LVMH Fashion Group, unofficially unites two fashion empires.

display_asset.caption: From left, Logan Green, chief executive of Lyft; Daniel Ammann, president of General Motors; and John Zimmer, president of Lyft.

summaries.body: General Motors has invested $500 million in Lyft, the car-sharing service announced on Monday, and will help the company develop a network of self-driving cars.

display_asset.caption: Dogs and their owners gather on the steps of the Sydney Opera House in 2010 for the “Music for Dogs” concert.

summaries.body: Dogs and their owners are invited to a concert by the performance artist Laurie Anderson in Times Square at 11:30 p.m. Monday, part of this month's Midnight Moment.

display_asset.caption: Soldiers inspecting a house in Imphal, the capital of Manipur State, which collapsed after an earthquake struck northeast India.

summaries.body: A 6.7-magnitude earthquake hit northeast India before dawn on Monday, killing at least six people.

display_asset.caption: The house on 86th Street in Woodhaven, Queens, where Joceline Romo, 19, was killed.
display_asset.credit: Uli Seit for The New York Times

summaries.body: The death of a 19-year-old woman in Queens on New Year's Day is New York City's first homicide in 2016.

display_asset.credit: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

summaries.body: Uganda's doctors treat patients at the end of their lives with exceptional care, according to a global index, thanks partly to a doctor’s recipe for a form of liquid morphine.

display_asset.caption: From left, Gary Gersh, Angus McIndoe and actor Nathan Lane sitting on Sunday for the last time at Angus’ Cafe Bistro (with a portrait of Mr. Lane by Rainer Andreesen).
display_asset.credit: Hilary Swift for The New York Times

summaries.body: Angus’ Cafe Bistro, a restaurant on West 44th Street that was popular among Broadway stars and producers, has closed after 14 years.

display_asset.credit: Kaiser Permanente San Diego, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Jaelyn and Luis Valencia are twins with birthdays in different years. Jaelyn was born in the waning seconds of 2015. Three minutes later, Luis was born in 2016.

display_asset.caption: Olivia V. Cranshaw sold 1,647 boxes of Girl Scout cookies in 2015, the first year the organization allowed web sales. In all, 160,000 scouts have started using the digital cookie program.
display_asset.credit: Ryan Stone for The New York Times

summaries.body: Girl Scout cookies are being sold online for the second year, with Visa and Dell investing an estimated $3 million to help improve the platform.

display_asset.caption: As in many games this season, Tom Coughlin was left frustrated Sunday despite holding a second-half lead.

summaries.body: The Eagles beat the Giants, 35-30, in what might have been Tom Coughlin’s final game after 12 seasons as the Giants' coach.

display_asset.caption: The New York State attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, said FanDuel and DraftKings have engaged in “repeated and persistent fraudulent acts.”
display_asset.credit: Sam Hodgson for The New York Times

summaries.body: The New York State attorney general amended his lawsuit against FanDuel and DraftKings, demanding that the fantasy sites pay back what they have made in the state.
He had planned to watch the ball drop in Times Square. But early Thursday, he was killed, attacked by six men in the Bronx.

display_asset.caption: "Clipping Index I,'' a suite of drawings by the Los Angeles painter Jonas Wood.
display_asset.credit: Jonas Wood/Courtesy of the artist and Gagosian Gallery

summaries.body: Last year saw dizzying auction peaks in the art market, but also signs of slowing growth. Modern art roared on, while old masters and young stars lost value.
Wayne Rogers, who starred as Trapper John McIntyre in the first three seasons of the long-running television series "M.A.S.H.," has died at 82.

display_asset.caption: Pope Francis at a Mass at St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican City on Friday.

summaries.body: In his first message of 2016, Pope Francis called on people to overcome indifference, and to open their hearts to the needs of others.
The copyright of Adolf Hitler's "Mein Kampf" expired in Germany. A historical institute in Munich will publish a new edition, aiming to show that it is incoherent.
In his annual New Year's speech, Kim Jong-un said he was willing to discuss reconciliation with South Korea, but warned that North Korea's military would also pursue “more diverse” capabilities.
President Paul Kagame of Rwanda says he will seek a third term in 2017, which was widely expected after the country's Constitution was changed to allow it.
A health aide, Eter Nikolaishvili, 28, has been charged with assault after being accused of forcefully twisting the arm of the architect I. M. Pei, 98, in his New York City home.
